SEARCH
Package com.example.projectv2.Controller

Class EventController

java.lang.Object
com.example.projectv2.Controller.EventController
public class EventController extends Object
Controller for handling event-related operations in Firestore, including event creation, updating, fetching, and entrant list management.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    EventController.EventCallback
    Callback interface for event-related operations to communicate results back to the calling class.
    static interface 
    EventController.ImageUpdateCallback
    Callback interface for image update operations, to indicate completion status.

  • Constructor Details

    • EventController

      public EventController(android.content.Context context)
      Constructs an EventController with the specified context, initializing the Firestore database instance.
      Parameters:
      context - the context in which this controller operates

  • Method Details

    • createEvent

      public void createEvent(String owner, String name, String detail, String rules, String deadline, String attendees, String entrants, String startDate, String ticketPrice, boolean geolocationEnabled, android.net.Uri selectedImageUri, String facility, EventController.EventCallback callback)
      Creates a new event with the specified details, uploads the event image to Firebase Storage (if provided), and saves the event to Firestore.
      Parameters:
      owner - the owner of the event (device ID)
      name - the name of the event
      detail - details of the event
      rules - rules of the event
      deadline - deadline of the event
      attendees - number of attendees
      entrants - number of entrants allowed
      startDate - start date of the event
      ticketPrice - ticket price of the event
      geolocationEnabled - if geolocation is enabled for the event
      selectedImageUri - URI of the selected image for the event (optional)
      facility - facility information for the event
      callback - callback to handle success or error

    • updateEventImage

      public void updateEventImage(String eventId, android.net.Uri newImageUri, EventController.ImageUpdateCallback callback)
      Updates the event image in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the ID of the event whose image is to be updated
      newImageUri - URI of the new image to update
      callback - callback to handle the update result

    • fetchEvents

      public void fetchEvents(EventController.EventCallback callback)
      Fetches a list of all events from Firestore and notifies the callback with the event data.
      Parameters:
      callback - callback to handle the loaded events or errors

    • fetchCreatedEvents

      public void fetchCreatedEvents(EventController.EventCallback callback)
      Fetches a list of events created by the user from Firestore and notifies the callback with the event data.
      Parameters:
      callback - callback to handle the loaded events or errors

    • fetchRelatedEvents

      public void fetchRelatedEvents(EventController.EventCallback callback)
      Fetches a list of events where the user (deviceID) is in any part of the entrantList from Firestore and notifies the callback with the event data.
      Parameters:
      callback - callback to handle the loaded events or errors

    • checkAndAddEntrant

      public void checkAndAddEntrant(String eventId, String name, String email, String phoneNumber, EventController.EventCallback callback)
      Checks if an entrant can be added to an event, and if so, adds the entrant's details. If the entrant list reaches its limit, an error is reported.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the ID of the event to add the entrant to
      name - the name of the entrant
      email - the email of the entrant
      phoneNumber - the phone number of the entrant
      callback - callback to handle success or error
